intro: Echinocystis fabacea var. agrestis, commonly known as the rough jimsonweed, is a variant of the species Echinocystis fabacea. It is a flowering plant in the family Convolvulaceae, characterized by its trailing growth habit and distinctive yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It is native to the southern United States and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Due to its toxic properties, it is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
